questions.question_text: Which one of the lanthanoids given below is the most stable in divalent form?

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : [Ni(CN)4]2$$-$$ is square planar and diamagnetic complex, with dsp2 hybridization for Ni but [Ni(CO)4] is tetrahedral, paramagnetic and with sp3-hybridication for Ni.

Statement  II : [NiCl4]2$$-$$ and [Ni(CO)4] both have same d-electron configuration have same geometry and are paramagnetic.

In light the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
option_texts.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
option_texts.C: Statement I is correct but Statement II is false.
option_texts.D: Statement I is false but Statement II is correct.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which one of the following techniques is not used to spot components of a mixture separated on thin layer chromatographic plate?

option_texts.C: Visualisation agent as a component of mobile phase

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The formula of the purple colour formed in Laissaigne's test for sulphur using sodium nitroprusside is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
A 2.0 g sample containing MnO2 is treated with HCl liberating Cl2. The Cl2 gas is passed into a solution of KI and 60.0 mL of 0.1 M Na2S2O3 is required to titrate the liberated iodine. The percentage of MnO2 in the sample is _____________. (Nearest integer)

[Atomic masses (in u) Mn = 55; Cl = 35.5; O = 16, I = 127, Na = 23, K = 39, S = 32]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
If the work function of a metal is 6.63 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$19J, the maximum wavelength of the photon required to remove a photoelectron from the metal is ____________ nm. (Nearest integer)

[Given : h = 6.63 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$34 J s, and c = 3 $$\times$$ 108 m s$$-$$1]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The hybridization of P exhibited in PF5 is spxdy. The value of y is __________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: 4.0 L of an ideal gas is allowed to expand isothermally into vacuum until the total volume is 2.0 L. The amount of heat absorbed in this expansion is ____________ L atm.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The vapour pressures of two volatile liquids A and B at 25$$^\circ$$C are 50 Torr and 100 Torr, respectively. If the liquid mixture contains 0.3 mole fraction of A, then the mole fraction of liquid B in the vapour phase is $${x \over {17}}$$. The value of x is ______________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The solubility product of a sparingly soluble salt A2X3 is 1.1 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$23. If specific conductance of the solution is 3 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$5 S m$$-$$1, the limiting molar conductivity of the solution is $$x \,\times$$ 10$$-$$3 S m2 mol$$-$$1. The value of x is ___________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The quantity of electricity in Faraday needed to reduce 1 mol of Cr2O$$_7^{2 - }$$ to Cr3+ is ____________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
For a first order reaction A $$\to$$ B, the rate constant, k = 5.5 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$14 s$$-$$1. The time required for 67% completion of reaction is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$1 times the half life of reaction. The value of x is _____________ (Nearest integer)

(Given : log 3 = 0.4771)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Number of complexes which will exhibit synergic bonding amongst, $$[Cr{(CO)_6}]$$, $$[Mn{(CO)_5}]$$ and $$[M{n_2}{(CO)_{10}}]$$ is ___________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
In the estimation of bromine, 0.5 g of an organic compound gave 0.40 g of silver bromide. The percentage of bromine in the given compound is _________ % (nearest integer)

(Relative atomic masses of Ag and Br are 108u and 80u, respectively).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If the system of linear equations

$$2x + 3y - z =  - 2$$

$$x + y + z = 4$$

$$x - y + |\lambda |z = 4\lambda  - 4$$

where, $$\lambda$$ $$\in$$ R, has no solution, then

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The total number of 5-digit numbers, formed by using the digits 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7 without repetition, which are multiple of 6, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let A1, A2, A3, ....... be an increasing geometric progression of positive real numbers. If A1A3A5A7 = $${1 \over {1296}}$$ and A2 + A4 = $${7 \over {36}}$$, then the value of A6 + A8 + A10 is equal to

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let [t] denote the greatest integer less than or equal to t. Then, the value of the integral $$\int\limits_0^1 {[ - 8{x^2} + 6x - 1]dx} $$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics

option_texts.A: There exists a, b, c $$\in$$ R such that f is continuous on R.
option_texts.B: If f is discontinuous at exactly one point, then a + b + c = 1
option_texts.C: If f is discontinuous at exactly one point, then a + b + c $$\ne$$ 1
option_texts.D: f is discontinuous at at least two points, for any values of a, b and c

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The area of the region S = {(x, y) : y2 $$\le$$ 8x, y $$\ge$$ $$\sqrt2$$x, x $$\ge$$ 1} is

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let the solution curve $$y = y(x)$$ of the differential equation

$$\left[ {{x \over {\sqrt {{x^2} - {y^2}} }} + {e^{{y \over x}}}} \right]x{{dy} \over {dx}} = x + \left[ {{x \over {\sqrt {{x^2} - {y^2}} }} + {e^{{y \over x}}}} \right]y$$

pass through the points (1, 0) and (2$$\alpha$$, $$\alpha$$), $$\alpha$$ > 0. Then $$\alpha$$ is equal to

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let y = y(x) be the solution of the differential equation $$x(1 - {x^2}){{dy} \over {dx}} + (3{x^2}y - y - 4{x^3}) = 0$$, $$x > 1$$, with $$y(2) =  - 2$$. Then y(3) is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
The number of real solutions of 

$${x^7} + 5{x^3} + 3x + 1 = 0$$ is equal to ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The probability, that in a randomly selected 3-digit number at least two digits are odd, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let R1 and R2 be relations on the set {1, 2, ......., 50} such that

R1 = {(p, pn) : p is a prime and n $$\ge$$ 0 is an integer} and

R2 = {(p, pn) : p is a prime and n = 0 or 1}.

Then, the number of elements in R1 $$-$$ R2 is _______________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of real solutions of the equation $${e^{4x}} + 4{e^{3x}} - 58{e^{2x}} + 4{e^x} + 1 = 0$$ is ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The mean and standard deviation of 15 observations are found to be 8 and 3 respectively. On rechecking it was found that, in the observations, 20 was misread as 5. Then, the correct variance is equal to _____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If $$\overrightarrow a  = 2\widehat i + \widehat j + 3\widehat k$$, $$\overrightarrow b  = 3\widehat i + 3\widehat j + \widehat k$$ and $$\overrightarrow c  = {c_1}\widehat i + {c_2}\widehat j + {c_3}\widehat k$$ are coplanar vectors and $$\overrightarrow a \,.\,\overrightarrow c  = 5$$, $$\overrightarrow b  \bot \overrightarrow c $$, then $$122({c_1} + {c_2} + {c_3})$$ is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: A ray of light passing through the point P(2, 3) reflects on the x-axis at point A and the reflected ray passes through the point Q(5, 4). Let R be the point that divides the line segment AQ internally into the ratio 2 : 1. Let the co-ordinates of the foot of the perpendicular M from R on the bisector of the angle PAQ be ($$\alpha$$, $$\beta$$). Then, the value of 7$$\alpha$$ + 3$$\beta$$ is equal to ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let A = {1, a1, a2 ....... a18, 77} be a set of integers with 1 1 2 18 1 + a2 + ...... + a18 is equal to _____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of positive integers k such that the constant term in the binomial expansion of $${\left( {2{x^3} + {3 \over {{x^k}}}} \right)^{12}}$$, x $$\ne$$ 0 is 28 . l, where l is an odd integer, is ______________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of elements in the set {z = a + ib $$\in$$ C : a, b $$\in$$ Z and 1 < | z $$-$$ 3 + 2i | < 4} is __________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : Product of Pressure (P) and time (t) has the same dimension as that of coefficient of viscosity.

Reason R : Coefficient of viscosity = $${{Force} \over {Velocity\,gradient}}$$

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.B: Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.C: A is true but R is false.
option_texts.D: A is false but R is true.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A particle of mass m is moving in a circular path of constant radius r such that its centripetal acceleration (a) is varying with time t as a = k2rt2, where k is a constant. The power delivered to the particle by the force acting on it is given as

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Motion of a particle in x-y plane is described by a set of following equations $$x = 4\sin \left( {{\pi  \over 2} - \omega t} \right)\,m$$ and $$y = 4\sin (\omega t)\,m$$. The path of the particle will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Match List-I with List-II


.tg  {border-collapse:collapse;border-spacing:0;}
.tg td{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg th{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  font-weight:normal;overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg .tg-c3ow{border-color:inherit;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-0pky{border-color:inherit;text-align:left;vertical-align:top}









  
    
    List-I
    
    List-II
  


  
    (A)
    Moment of inertia of solid sphere of radius R about any tangent.
    (I)
    $${5 \over 3}M{R^2}$$
  
  
    (B)
    Moment of inertia of hollow sphere of radius (R) about any tangent.
    (II)
    $${7 \over 5}M{R^2}$$
  
  
    (C)
    Moment of inertia of circular ring of radius (R) about its diameter.
    (III)
    $${1 \over 4}M{R^2}$$
  
  
    (D)
    Moment of inertia of circular disc of radius (R) about any diameter.
    (IV)
    $${1 \over 2}M{R^2}$$
  



Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: A - II, B - I, C - IV, D - III
option_texts.B: A - I, B - II, C - IV, D - III
option_texts.C: A - II, B - I, C - III, D - IV
option_texts.D: A - I, B - II, C - III, D - IV

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two planets A and B of equal mass are having their period of revolutions TA and TB such that TA = 2TB. These planets are revolving in the circular orbits of radii rA and rB respectively. Which out of the following would be the correct relationship of their orbits?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A water drop of diameter 2 cm is broken into 64 equal droplets. The surface tension of water is 0.075 N/m. In this process the gain in surface energy will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : When $$\mu$$ amount of an ideal gas undergoes adiabatic change from state (P1, V1, T1) to state (P2, V2, T2), then work done is $$W = {{\mu R({T_2} - {T_1})} \over {1 - \gamma }}$$, where $$\gamma  = {{{C_p}} \over {{C_v}}}$$ and R = universal gas constant.

Statement II : In the above case, when work is done on the gas, the temperature of the gas would rise.

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
option_texts.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
option_texts.C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
option_texts.D: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : A point charge is brought in an electric field. The value of electric field at a point near to the charge may increase if the charge is positive.

Statement II : An electric dipole is placed in a non-uniform electric field. The net electric force on the dipole will not be zero.

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
option_texts.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
option_texts.C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
option_texts.D: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The three charges q/2, q and q/2 are placed at the corners A, B and C of a square of side 'a' as shown in figure. The magnitude of electric field (E) at the corner D of the square, is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
An infinitely long hollow conducting cylinder with radius R carries a uniform current along its surface.

Choose the correct representation of magnetic field (B) as a function of radial distance (r) from the axis of cylinder.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A radar sends an electromagnetic signal of electric field (E0) = 2.25 V/m and magnetic field (B0) = 1.5 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$8 T which strikes a target on line of sight at a distance of 3 km in a medium. After that, a part of signal (echo) reflects back towards the radar with same velocity and by same path. If the signal was transmitted at time t = 0 from radar, then after how much time echo will reach to the radar?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The refracting angle of a prism is A and refractive index of the material of the prism is cot (A/2). Then the angle of minimum deviation will be -

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The aperture of the objective is 24.4 cm. The resolving power of this telescope, if a light of wavelength 2440 $$\mathop A\limits^o $$ is used to see th object will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The de Broglie wavelengths for an electron and a photon are $$\lambda$$e and $$\lambda$$p respectively. For the same kinetic energy of electron and photon, which of the following presents the correct relation between the de Broglie wavelengths of two ?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The Q-value of a nuclear reaction and kinetic energy of the projectile particle, Kp are related as :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: For using a multimeter to identify diode from electrical components, choose the correct statement out of the following about the diode :

option_texts.A: It is two terminal device which conducts current in both directions.
option_texts.B: It is two terminal device which conducts current in one direction only.
option_texts.C: It does not conduct current gives an initial deflection which decays to zero.
option_texts.D: It is three terminal device which conducts current in one direction only between central terminal and either of the remaining two terminals

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The velocity of sound in a gas, in which two wavelengths 4.08 m and 4.16 m produce 40 beats in 12s, will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A pendulum is suspended by a string of length 250 cm. The mass of the bob of the pendulum is 200 g. The bob is pulled aside until the string is at 60$$^\circ$$ with vertical as shown in the figure. After releasing the bob, the maximum velocity attained by the bob will be ____________ ms$$-$$1. (if g = 10 m/s2)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A meter bridge setup is shown in the figure. It is used to determine an unknown resistance R using a given resistor of 15 $$\Omega$$. The galvanometer (G) shows null deflection when tapping key is at 43 cm mark from end A. If the end correction for end A is 2 cm, then the determined value of R will be ____________ $$\Omega$$.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Current measured by the ammeter (A) in the reported circuit when no current flows through 10 $$\Omega$$ resistance, will be ________________ A.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An AC source is connected to an inductance of 100 mH, a capacitance of 100 $$\mu$$F and a resistance of 120 $$\Omega$$ as shown in figure. The time in which the resistance having a thermal capacity 2 J/$$^\circ$$C will get heated by 16$$^\circ$$C is _____________ s.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The position vector of 1 kg object is $$\overrightarrow r  = \left( {3\widehat i - \widehat j} \right)m$$ and its velocity $$\overrightarrow v  = \left( {3\widehat j + \widehat k} \right)m{s^{ - 1}}$$. The magnitude of its angular momentum is $$\sqrt x $$ Nm where x is ___________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A man of 60 kg is running on the road and suddenly jumps into a stationary trolly car of mass 120 kg. Then, the trolly car starts moving with velocity 2 ms$$-$$1. The velocity of the running man was ___________ ms$$-$$1, when he jumps into the car.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A hanging mass M is connected to a four times bigger mass by using a string-pulley arrangement, as shown in the figure. The bigger mass is placed on a horizontal ice-slab and being pulled by 2 Mg force. In this situation, tension in the string is $${x \over 5}$$ Mg for x = ______________. Neglect mass of the string and friction of the block (bigger mass) with ice slab.

(Given g = acceleration due to gravity)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The total internal energy of two mole monoatomic ideal gas at temperature T = 300 K will be _____________ J. (Given R = 8.31 J/mol.K)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A singly ionized magnesium atom (A = 24) ion is accelerated to kinetic energy 5 keV, and is projected perpendicularly into a magnetic field B of the magnitude 0.5 T. The radius of path formed will be _____________ cm.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A telegraph line of length 100 km has a capacity of 0.01 $$\mu$$F/km and it carries an alternating current at 0.5 kilo cycle per second. If minimum impedance is required, then the value of the inductance that needs to be introduced in series is _____________ mH. (if $$\pi$$ = $$\sqrt{10}$$)
